text: قال اراغب انت عن ءالهتى يابرهيم لئن لم تنته لارجمنك واهجرنى مليا

translations.translation: He said, 'Do you forsake my gods, Ibrahim? If you do not stop, I will stone you. Keep away from me for a good long time.'
He said: "Are you averse to my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall have you stoned to death. So go away for a while from me."
The father said: "Abraham, have you turned away from my gods? If you do not give this up, I shall stone you to death. Now begone from me forever."
His father replied, "Abraham, are you telling me to give-up my gods? If you will not stop this, I shall stone you to death. Leave my house and do not come back again".
He said, “What! You turn away from my Gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you, and keep no relation with me for a long while.”
He (the father) said: "Do you revile my gods, O Ibrahim If you stop not (this), I will La'arjumannak. So get away from me Maliyan."
He said: Do you dislike my gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist I will certainly revile you, and leave me for a time.
Said he, 'What, art thou shrinking from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if thou givest not over, I shall stone thee; so forsake me now for some while.'
He said: Rejectest thou my gods, O Abraham? If thou cease not, I shall surely stone thee. Depart from me a long while!
[His father] said, "Do you reject my deities, Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall surely stone you to death. Keep out of my way!"
He said: art thou averse to my gods, O Ibrahim? If thou desistest not, surely I shall stone thee; and depart from me for ever so long.
He said, ‘Abraham! Are you renouncing my gods? If you do not desist, I will stone you. Get away from me for a long while.’
(The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"
He (the father) said: "Do you reject my gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)? If you stop not (this), I will indeed stone you. So get away from me safely before I punish you."
But he replied: 'Do you shrink away from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if you do not cease I will stone you, so leave me for awhile'
He said, “Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will stone you. So leave me alone for a while.”
[His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."

[19:46] He said, ‘Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham?, so that you are denouncing them [in this way]? If you do not desist, from criticising them, I shall surely assail you, with stones, or with evil words, so beware of me; and stay away from me for a long time’.

(He said) Azar said: (Rejectest thou my gods) do you reject the worship of my deities, (0 Abraham? If thou cease not) from what you say, (I shall surely stone thee) I will kill you. (Depart from me a long while!) stay away from me as long as you live; it is also said that this means: leave me and do not speak with me for a long time.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { وَٱهْجُرْنِي مَلِيّاً } معناه دهرٌ
 وقال: حينٌ

translations.translation:
And His saying, "And keep me away from the unjust" [Qur'an 12:28], its meaning is "dunya."
 And he said: "A time."

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
مع أن عبادتهم أولى وأليق بحالك { يٰإِبْرَاهِيمُ } إذ خير الأولاد أن يتبع آباءه في الدين
 سيما وقد سلف أجدادك على هذا وأنت استنكفت عن عبادة آلهتنا
 انتهِ عن اعتقادك هذا
 واللهِ { لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ } ولم تمتنع { لأَرْجُمَنَّكَ } وأرميَنَّك بالأحجار على رءوس الأشهاد حتى تموت
 قم من عندي { وَٱهْجُرْنِي } واتركني { مَلِيّاً } [مريم: 46] زماناً طويلاً
 فإن ندمت عن اعتقادك هذا
 ورجعتَ إلى ما كنا عليه
 يعني عبادة الأصنام
 فارجع إليّ
 وإلا فاذهب لا علاقة بين وبينك فأا بريء منك


ثم لما رأى إبراهيم عليه السلام شدة غيّه وضلاله

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
قلت: هذا استئناف بياني
 مبني على سؤال نشأ عن صدر الكلام
 كأنه قيل: فماذا قال أبوه عندما سمع هذه النصائح الواجبة القبول؟ فقال مصرًا على عناده: أراغب


 الخ
 يقول الحقّ جلّ جلاله: { قال } له أبوه في جوابه: { أراغبٌ أنتَ عن آلهتي } أي: أمعرض ومنصرف أنت عنها فوجّه الإنكار إلى نفس الرغبة
 مع ضرب من التعجب
 كأن الرغبة عنها مما لا يصدر عن العاقل
 فضلاً عن ترغيب الغير عنها
 ثم هدده فقال: { لئن لم تَنْتَهِ } عن وعظك { لأرجُمنَّكَ } بالحجارة
 أي: والله لئن لم تنته عما أنت عليه من النهي عن عبادتها لأرجمنك بالحجر
 وقيل باللسان
 { واهجرني } أي: واتركني { مَلِيًّا } أي: زمنًا طويلاً
 أو ما دام الأبد
 ويسمى الليل والنهار مَلَوان
 وهو عطف على محذوف
 أي: احذرني واهجرني
